body.p: The Multi-Output PDU Option allows the single output voltage of the PDUâ€™s transformer to be reconfigured in the field for alternate voltages. The transformer can be set to only one output voltage at a time. Each voltage is rated for 100% load. See section for configuration options.

Reconfiguring the transformer voltage requires these steps:
Relocating the neutral jumper bus bar and changing internal PDU parameters. Relocating the neutral jumper bus bar must be done from the rear of the PDU while the PDU is offline and powered down.
Changing parameters on the PDU (M4G) Board for the changed output voltage. It is recommended that the transformer output voltage be reconfigured by an Eaton service representative or other authorized technician. Changes to the PDU Board can only be performed by an Eaton service representative or other authorized technician.

xi:include.href: Repositioning the Neutral Jumper Bus Bar.dita

topic.title: One-Line Diagram for Multi-Output PDU Option

body.p: The following is a 1-line diagram for a 750 kVA PDU with the Multi-Output PDU Option. This drawing shows monitoring through a Static Transfer Switch in a primary system configuration. One-Line Diagram, PowerHub 2 PDU 750 kVA with Multi-Output PDU Option
